website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy stroller that's well built and has the basics at a reasonable price.
cons: There's no storage except for the cup holder

customer_reviews.title: I love the stroller very easy to push
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (June 22, 2017). I love the stroller very easy to push, fits through standard doorways, reclining sits are amazing. I gave this a four star because there is no storage. I have a single Kolcraft Cloud stroller and it has the storage space on bottom and I love it. The other down fall which it hasn't happen to this stroller yet is that the canopy doesn't hold its shape very well. I'll keep you post on that. UPDATE...I have used several times and the canopy's are holding up great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: Yes!! Perfect lightweight stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stroller! Bought this to take on a trip with our two year olds. It gate checked no problem. Adjustable and d expandable canopy is awesome. A cup holder for my coffee as well! Very easy to fold up and store as well as pull out and use. Assembly was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Dundas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STROLLER FOR THE MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck double travel stroller ever!! Never thought that we would straight swap our regular double stroller (10x the price) but this stroller was bought for recent trips and has not let us down. It is so simple to setup and breakdown it has become out primary double!! High recommend at the price point. Easy assembly but be careful with the sun shade as it is easily malformed. This would be the perfect stroller if it had storage but we use a simple stroller organizer on the handles and have been super happy!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: As the first day of using it I love it, it reclines enough for them to sleep, it's easy to fold, easy to use, even with my 4 year old and my 2 year old it drives very smooth. The canopy covers almost completely. I just wish it came with a mesh or something to put my stuff but I used a regular stroller organizer and that was enough. Easy to assemble too.
customer_reviews.author: Bebis

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but better than others
customer_reviews.text: I LIIKE HOW EASY IT IS TO MOVE AROUND, IN AND OUT THE CAR EXT.. BUT I JUST DONT LIKE THE SHADING UMBRELAS . They keep on falling off and not staying straight. I try to make them work since I needed a shade for my girls but I ended up taking them off because they just didn't fit well . ONe was just too small to stay up. I also regret buying this product for not having a down storage area where I can just put my phone or drinks, or toys or snacks.. the drink holder is just too small. I do like the incline position and the nice material it is made off.
customer_reviews.author: miroslava

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a hot vacation
customer_reviews.text: Great price for nicer features. The extended canopy and vented seats were perfect for our Bahamas vacation. Can not imagine the trip without it. The maximum weight is so low but we easily carried 100lbs on it daily walking all over Atlantis for long hours and though the airport. I used it for my 34lb 2 year old and 41lb 3 year old. Both of my girls are in the 90th percentile for height and weight and fit comfortably in the stroller. The seats reclined just enough to allow naps. The stroller just barely fit through doors, every once in while we had to jiggle our way through a smaller doorway but it still fit. Best purchase for our vacation.
customer_reviews.author: S Hamp

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my niece and nephew when they came over after a trip from back home as something like this costs a lot. She loved it and the kids were happy sitting in it and now they both can ride at the same time. The material is good material I did have a couple issues with the top part and the seller was very happy to help and to connect with me
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. The canopy was a little challenge to install ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. The canopy was a little challenge to install and still one of them look a little off but overall I am very please so far! just got and put in my 5 and 3 years old and it is smooth and easy ride. I bought it for my 3 yeas old and my 11 months old but she was sleeping. Good looking stroller. And you can't beat the price!!! Good quality. I was hesitant bout the storage..is none and the fact that is not tray for the kids but I ordered some generic solutions to add storage and bottles so I know we will be fine!
customer_reviews.author: cam5150

customer_reviews.title: Overall OK
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy it after have checked the reviews. First, the quality and overall features definitely worth the price. (Or better than I expected by paying this price) easy to fold and unfold. The only downside to us is its size and weight. Feels heavier than described. Still takes the full trunk to store it. So if you are a skinny woman (like me) it probably won’t make your job a lot easier. But as a casual stroller I will definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing flower

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is exactly what we were looking for. Very portable for quick trips. Easy to fold. Lightweight. Doesn’t take up too much room in the car. The sunshades provide great coverage! The only negatives would be lack of storage and the cup holder is not very secure. But I am able to hang my very heavy diaper bad off the back without it tipping over when the kids aren’t in the stroller, so that’s a huge plus!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kate

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: This stroller is NOT 31" wide. At the front wheels this stroller measures 32 1/8" wide.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This stroller is NOT 31" wide. At the front wheels this stroller measures 32 1/8" wide. Disney now restricts strollers to 31" wide
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Space saver!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it’s a great product. I wish it was a tad thinner, but then again, you really can’t ask for too much when it comes to a double side by side stroller lol. I also always manage to kick the dang wheel thing in the center. That’s a little annoying. I have taken in on trails and it works better than expected on those. Smooth ride. Lightweight. Doesn’t take up much room in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Lots of stroller in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This really gets the job done. Took it on the plane and to Disney. It's less than half the size of our joovy double stroller without really sacrificing convenience. I added a velcro pocket on the back for a little storage. It's prone to tipping if you hang a big bag from the handles but that's typical of all strollers. This is our new trunk stroller. The joovy is now just for neighborhood walks.
customer_reviews.author: Leslon

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this stroller.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was a good stroller, lightweight, easy to fold and generous canopies. Good for a day at the zoo or amusement park. However it did not fit through a standard door at the Dr. office and I really needed a stroller that fit doorways. I’m also on the shorter side 5’1” so the handles were also awkward too wide apart. We ended up returning it and getting the Maclaren Twin triumph stroller.
customer_reviews.author: GingerLola

customer_reviews.title: Overall great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has some flaws, but overall does the job. We were tired of our heavy, gigantic double stroller, and wanted something light that won't take space. This stroller is great in both weight and storage categories. The down side is: 1. Parent storage - there isn't any. 2. The arch that holds the shade canopy bends every time we fold the stroller. Annoying? Yes. Terrible? No. Worth the price? Absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Mexico
customer_reviews.text: I have an orbit and another double stroller that is too bulky. Wanted something for travel and Disney. We took it to Mexico and we beat this thing up and it survived! Lol It reclines, has big canopy for shade and folds very thin. Yeah there's no storage, so get some hooks and attach to it. Good luck :)
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good stroller. The canopy is on both sides do not pulled over neatly. They kind of shift sideways. And I wish the cup holders were designed a little better where we're already attached to the stroller. And I wish that there was storage underneath the stroller to put things because there is nowhere to put anything. Even if they had little pockets in the back or something.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this double stroller! We initially purchased it for our drip to Disney. It folded and turned very easily. Our kids loved it (5 y/o 35 lbs and 2 y/o 30 lbs). Lightweight. Not much basket space, but we usually carried our stuff in a backpack or diaper bag (hung on the handles when it carrying). The sun shades covered quite a bit. We were able to raise the back flap for warmer weather and lower it when it got cool. The seats took minimal effort to recline. We still love using this stroller for other outings. Great buy! I would buy this again and recommend it to others!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Crystal Prince

customer_reviews.title: I like that it fits through most doors and if it ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits through most doors and if it doesn’t turn it sideways and drag it through,lol. However the wimpy latch to keep it folded up is almost useless as it’s made of a very flexible plastic. Stroller unfolds all the time when loading or unloading from the trunk. The cup holder pops off to easily as well with my hectic shopping ventures with four kids I need a reliable cup holder. Still it’s not bad for the price and the roll up backs are great for hot summers which was my main reason for choosing this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Badarayana lawton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel !!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this stroller!! Bought it for a trip to the Bahamas and it was perfect!!! The only downside for me was the canopy. It constantly came off and didn’t cover very well, but the stroller itself is amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This stroller worked perfectly for us on a big trip where we clocked in a lot of time passing through airports and timezones. It helped us so much to have a stroller where our daughters could take a nap. The little shade covers worked great, too. I have to give a big shout out to Kolcraft, too, because when I put the stroller together for the first time a few days before we left I discovered that one of the middle wheels wasn't sent with the shipment. I called them and they overnighted me a new wheel. I really don't know what we would have done without this stroller. It's a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Light weight stroller with a Simple design
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 3 year old and 18 month old. It is a no frills kind of stroller, but I like the simplicity. I like the fact that each seat can recline back, however it does require some adjustments that can be a hassle to reconnect. Also it won't fold up if the seats are in the reclined position. The sun shade provides adequate protection.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Stroller of all strollers!! Light and easy to push and steer
customer_reviews.text: This is my sixth yes sixth stroller and by far my favorite of all time. Other strollers have their place but this one is great for two toddlers or small children. So easy to fold, so LIGHT to push and easy to turn! I couldn’t believe it. I was mad I wasted money and time on my other sit and stand stroller. The shaded hoods are perfect and I love the cup holder. I wish there was a storage basket but you could easily attach something to the handles. Best of all a GREAT VALUE! Highly recommend and I get so many compliments!
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me, becasue I'm short and have a small strider. My husband hates to push it however. He is taller and has larger feet, so he feels slumped and is always kicking the back wheels when walking. It seems like there isn't much space for the person who is pushing to take normal steps. We only use on occasion for grandkids, so the compact folding feature is perfect to store having on the garage wall. Grandkids love sitting next to each other. They prefer my stroller over their moms which has them sitting one behind the other.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi N

customer_reviews.title: Double Umbrella Stroller On A Cruise Ship
customer_reviews.text: Nice Product. We took this on a recent cruise with us. The stroller is too big for the narrow passages outside the staterooms especially with the room attendants carts there all the time. The stroller also wouldn't fit through the narrow stateroom door either. If the kids were sleeping in the stroller we had to take them out of the stroller, fold it up in the hallway and than bring it in our cabin. I would think twice about bringing this on a cruise ship again. Aside from that the stroller seemed durable and operated as expected. I like how there are three different positions for the child to lie.
customer_reviews.author: W. Marin

customer_reviews.title: Simple , lightweight, great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller, whish I got it earlier. Originally purchased for our Disney trip and it was great! Fits through just about all door ways and very light weight. The wheels do get stuck in awkward positions sometimes when go through a door way if the get bumped. Other then that it is a smooth ride for my kiddos. It also has a sturdy mesh backing, my kiddos get sweaty and this keeps them cool. Sufficient shading and lays back individually. Wish there was a way to lock the detachable cupholder in place when in use anything can pop it off. Overall great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Torres

customer_reviews.title: You need this if you have two little ones
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller because we saw another family using one. We wanted a smaller, lighter double stroller, as we have a couple big heavy ones that we don't really like that much when travelling. This one folds easily, and both kids love to ride in it. Folds up nice and tight when not in use. Moves easily, and has become our first choice when needing our double stroller
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Steinke

customer_reviews.title: Stroller handles are too low.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good stroller, the only downside i see is the over all height. I am 6 feet and the handles to hold and push the stroller are a little too low for me. Either i have to bend a little while walking to hold them properly, or hold them by my finger tips ... Becomes a problem if you have to walk a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: I like this stroller but have found a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: I like this stroller but have found a couple issues. First, the seats want to pop back to the reclined portion, with very little effort so it happens sometimes while my kids are in it. Second, and most frustrating the shade doesn’t fit on the stroller well so it was constantly popping off and/or getting bent. This is frustrating because the main reason I selected this stroller over similar ones is the extended shade feature, which is a mute point since I just removed them entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda McDowell Cipolla

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble. Took me less than 15 minutes to assemble. I think it will work great for our summer vacations. I thought the seats would be more narrow and my 4 year old son was not going to be able to fit, but it isn't. I do wish that maybe it had a net on the bottom to place items under the stroller, but either way will still get my 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller so easy to put together. Easy to open and close. Can be pushed,opened, & closed with one hand (or can close using one foot). I wish I bought this and a click connect frame for my twins instead of wasting a thousand dollars on a big convertible twin stroller. The expensive stroller was awesome but this and the click connect frame strollers would have been just as good, lighter, and way cheaper! It’s around $280-$300 for both and the big convertible twin strollers are around $1100 with all the attachments and different seats etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for twins!
customer_reviews.text: this is so perfect for our twin grandbabies. The sun visors lock into place and the seats can recline. It folds up easily and doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Loooved this stroller! We bought it for our 3 week trip to Philippines & South Korea. It rolled real smooth. Both my kids were comfortable in it. It’s the perfect size for a compact double stroller, we fit through busy subway crowds with no problem, & made it through all kinds of different terrain. The handles were perfect for holding all of our shopping bags & other stuff. The only downside was not having a basket underneath & the shade. It’s kinda flimsy and stays kinda folded the whole time, but other than that everything was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: ry's mama

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a lightweight travel stroller that is easy to maneuver, easy enough to handle one handed and this one delivers. Kids are liking it and it's barely bigger and slightly heavier than my single umbrella stroller, not double the weight. Compact and fits my almost 3 yr old and 4.5 yr old comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Caution  PARENTS
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is very useful. Folds easy and is durable.. However, it doesn’t easily fit through a basic door. Every time I need to walk through a doorway it becomes a spectacle to watch. The door must be fully extended open and you still have to deal with the front free spinning wheels getting caught on the door frame. It really needs to be at least 3 inches smaller to get through a BASIC door smoothly. Other than that tremendous issue, the stroller is great for walks.
customer_reviews.author: aaron thomas

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent stroller Hard to maneuver NOT FOR THE TALL !! I al 5'11 and it was very hard for me to push around cause it killed my back very short and my mistake but it doewnt have shoulder straps and i feel every stroller needs shoulder straps
customer_reviews.author: amy schilt

customer_reviews.title: Foldable AND durable
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than expected, but also more durable. My huge 3 and 4 year old fit easily (and they are well off the growth chart) and they are clearly more comfortable in this model than others we’ve tried. The canopy is great too. We are planning on using it for our new baby and 1 year old, but I may get another for the big boys for special trips where it would be helpful to have them rest out of the sun (zoo, outdoor markets, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Laura Glanert

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This broke the second time we folded it. I bought this for a trip to Europe and it was very frustrating that we had a broken stroller that wouldn’t fold. Also, if your considering this for Europe, it did not fit through the majority of the doorways.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good compact stroller for long days with 2 kids!
customer_reviews.text: It’s what I was looking for - compact, light and fits my 3.5yo and baby. The wheels spin and get stuck but I can maneuver it back into place easily. The canopies are a bit crooked when folded but they have lots of shade which I love when expanded! I can strap the diaper bag on the handles and don’t care about not having storage! It has been super helpful for the theme parks so I’d Def recommend for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: NOT for every day
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is super flimsy. I still have trouble getting through the doors... so storage of any kind. The shades I took down right away... they don’t stay on right and it’s hard to fold the stroller with it on. I wouldn’t recommend it. This is a backup stroller, I am the grandma and don’t use it very much....
customer_reviews.author: Sabina

customer_reviews.title: My favorite feature is the visors are big/long/wide enough to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stroller to use on a trip that included the airport for my 14 month old twins. It is much lighter in weight than the tandem double stroller I have. I was able to unload it from my trunk and set it up using one hand and one foot. The handles are taller, which worked well for my husband who is over six feet tall. The seats to recline enough for a baby to catch a nap. My favorite feature is the visors are big/long/wide enough to keep the sun completely off baby. The only negative is that there is no storage on this stroller, but we just hung their diaper bag from the middle handle.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is a HUGE upgrade from our previous double stroller. Very lightweight and take up half the space. Only thing we don’t like is that there is no storage for bags and the cup holder comes off constantly. Living in Florida we love that the backs of the seat are mesh or lined depending on what want.
customer_reviews.author: Tawni A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stroller!
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, folds easily and has two positions for the kids. I'm 6'2" and the only problem I have is that is a little bit short for me, and there's no way to extend the handles. But otherwise, we love this stroller for our twins!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Morales Piloni

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: I am traveling on my own with two kiddos, 4 and 2, and needed a lightweight stroller for the airport. I normally use my BOB double stroller but it is so difficult to fold. This one easily folds down. And it was easy to put together, even the kids helped. Granted it’s not a BOB so I can feel myself having to push harder with this one even though it weighs half as much. Trading one good thing for the other.
customer_reviews.author: Gritty Mom

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the stroller is good and it's pretty light and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the stroller is good and it's pretty light and easy to maneuver. There is no storage on this stroller, which is a bummer. Also it would be great if the handles were a tad bit longer so you don't kick the wheels when you're walking if you're holding on to the two outermost handles (I'm 5'8" for reference.)
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: Nice for taller ppl like myself
customer_reviews.text: The wheels have to be assembled. Doesn’t take long. Higher handles than regular umbrella strollers which is why I bought this bc I’m 5’7 the short average strollers have me hunching over. This doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: KDL

customer_reviews.title: Nana Sue report
customer_reviews.text: The stroller arrived promptly and in good condition. There is a little assembly requires but it is not difficult and you don't have to have any tools. The stroller works great and I like that you can recline the seats and you can do them independently. The canopy is huge and other than its tight going through doorways(which you should expect) I think its a good value product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wimpee

customer_reviews.title: and my kids seemed mostly comfortable in it
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is just okay. I'm having a lot of trouble with the canopies, one of which arrived bent. They slide up and down the poles of the stroller where they attach - supremely irritating. I bought this stroller for a long trip, and my kids seemed mostly comfortable in it, but I wouldn't buy it again - I would probably spend a bit more to get some storage and perhaps some less crappy canopies.
customer_reviews.author: Farah

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Heavier then I expected. The shade gets all warped and bent out of shape when you fold up the stroller. Still trying to figure out how to solve this problem. Overall ok product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyra Lee

customer_reviews.title: A must for parents with kids who are a year or two apart
customer_reviews.text: It's very durable and easy to use. Glad that we made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Andy

customer_reviews.title: We needed a crib that we could easily collapse while traveling through several airports in Europe
customer_reviews.text: We needed a crib that we could easily collapse while traveling through several airports in Europe. The stroller held up well. The shades did not provide a lot of shade but they sufficed. It is a very sturdy stroller. It got through a two week trip in Europe and months later is still like new. It also fits in our Kia Soul trunk with room for other stuff to store as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeppeje

customer_reviews.title: It’s great but has a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose..taking a 19month old and 5 year old around universal studios. It is very easy to fold and works great! The only complain is 1. It’s difficult to get into right doorways, the wheels have to be juuust right. And 2. There is no under carriage storage, leaving you to hang items on the handles and if you aren’t careful becomes Very too heavy and tops over if your little ones are out of it or don’t weigh enough to keep it upright
customer_reviews.author: Erin Cox

customer_reviews.title: Not super sturdy and not tall enough
customer_reviews.text: Not super sturdy and not tall enough, so my back hurts by the end of the day, but for the price, it's decent. It gets the job done without taking up a tone of space and breaking your back when you have to carry it here and there. Really needs a bar across the top so you can push it more comfortably, but otherwise it has everything you Need. Also, the visors come down far enough to actually be useful, so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Gromitron

customer_reviews.title: The best stroller ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller tooo much ! Easy on budget, very efficient and super useful. I have three girls of all different ages. Travelling with them was really difficult until i found this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Sri Haritha Mantrala

customer_reviews.title: This stroller is extremely durable and comfortable for my LOs
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is extremely durable and comfortable for my LOs. Fits most doorways but it's fairly clumsy if you are planning to bring this to the mall and shop, gets stuck in the aisles and clothes racks. I have a sedan and this fits well, other double strollers requires more trunk space. pretty light and easy to fold and unfold for parents on the go
customer_reviews.author: furball

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, lightweight stroller that's great for theme parks!!! I'm very happy that it's not too flimsy and works great for my 3 year old twins!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Turns easy, light weight! I love it! This stroller was exactly what I was hoping for! Having no basket kinda sucks sometimes, but I'm not too worried about it. I can always buy an add on for storage if I really need it. Great quality for the price! I'm very pleased with this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Cassy

customer_reviews.title: nice stroller
customer_reviews.text: we have a large heave double stroller but needed something light weight and this fits the bill. If you want something that has storage this isn't for you but we got a mesh bag to attach to the back and it works for us. Both girls get to see out and the three point harness holds them in. there are two settings for recline and they work well. Overall good, afforadable double umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Stover

customer_reviews.title: I love it; especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is great, especially considering the price ($75). It's easy to assemble, and it looks like the pictures. The thing I like best is that, unlike most other strollers, the sunshade can extend low enough to shade babies' faces at any time of day, even when facing into the sun. Best of all, the 9-month-old twins whom I nanny for love it! It's quick and easy to get them in and out. The one thing that gives me some trouble is that the locking mechanism, when the stroller's folded, is pretty flimsy, and requires maneuvering the sunshade in a little bit so that it's not in the way as it's being folded and locked into place.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: No doorway friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I had A LOT of trouble fitting through regular size doors. I would have to turn it a certain way which was a huge hassle.
customer_reviews.author: LAKINYA

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great stroller. It's not really comfortable a push because the handles are way too low. At least for me and I'm always 6' tall.
customer_reviews.author: turfbill

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Missing important parts, does not work
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this package and paid more for “very good” condition instead of “good”. It arrived missing half of its parts needed to assemble it. My husband spent 45 minutes trying to figure out how to assemble it/where the parts were. We were going to use it on a trip, but now we won’t be able to buy another stroller before we go. DO NOT BUY THIS! It’s a waste of time and money and a big headache.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Eastin

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.  Both babies fit comfortably.  Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for grandbabies born 5 Months apart. Very sturdy. Relatively easy to maneuver in mall or other flat indoor surface. Can be a little more challenging on sidewalk. Should last for a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: MamaNitaj

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this twin umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this twin umbrella stroller. The only downside is ther isn't a storage canopy underneath, could use a snack tray and the cup holder is flimsy. Other than that this is a great buy and or twins love riding in it. They get to hold hands and steal each other's drinks
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: So much lighter than traditional double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Soo much better than my other double stroller. Fits through standard doorways. The best part is the shade on top. It’s hard to find a stroller that completely shades the kids. You can adjust each seat to a lying position and adjust the sun shade separately too.
customer_reviews.author: ElO

customer_reviews.title: Did the Job for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Disney. It did the job for sure. But one of the metal locks inverted. It still usable, but it’s harder to lock in position and it make that one seat sag a little. Also the umbrellas I just couldn’t get to work right. They were warped while folded. Sounds like a negative review, but for the price, the stroller did it’s job through the craziness of Disney. Kids liked it fine!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive all of the parts. I was missing the cotter pins which is vital in keeping the wheels on. Luckily my husband happened to have some in the garage. I did not want to have to go through the hassle of returning such a large item for something like that. I haven't used it yet but it seems to be a good stroller.
customer_reviews.author: karrah

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: We like this stroller BUT!!! The reclining feature SUCKS! Especially with a double stroller. So inconvenient. We use it because a. We already paid for it and it’s a hassle to return and b. It’s pretty light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Marcela

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, canopies could improve.
customer_reviews.text: Overall great stroller. It is light and easy to use. The stride is a little short so you step on the wheels when you walk if you are very tall this could be frustrating. It has made quick stops much easier for toting 2 under 2. The canopies did not arrive in very good shape. One is quite bent and they are not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: roxanne smith

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit through wider doors.
customer_reviews.text: I give this a 2 star rating because it doesn’t fit through doors. Even wider hospital ones. I want to love it but that kills it for me. It rides smooth, easy to push, folds easy... has so many positives except the fitting through doors.
customer_reviews.author: Catgreeneyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy Double Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good, inexpensive double umbrella, but unfortunately the clip for the shades broke upon trying to install it on the frame of the stroller. We were installing everything carefully, so I assume it was because it was a little too brittle for the clip.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. We bought it for vacation and I am so glad I did. I had a bulky double stroller for a previous vacation and it was miserable. I am glad my husband made me buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Arenas

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly hate this stroller. The cup never stays on, the visors are bent & cannot be molded back to original form. The only benefit is its light weight. Nothing else. We're scrapping this stroller & buying a different one.
customer_reviews.author: twinmummy

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 issue...
customer_reviews.text: The only down fall is that it DID NOT come with all the hardware to out the wheels on. My husband had to see what was missing and go to the hardware store and purchase them himself. Other then that it's so nice for my 1 and 2 year old. Super easy to lift and fold and fits nicely in the trunk of my car.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah kiley

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! We bought this to travel with 2 tykes and loved the big canopies, light weight and ease of folding up / unfolding. Seats recline. Yes it doesn't have a basket but we bought a J.L. Childress double stroller organizer and it fit beautifully-- the organizer adds additional cup holders and we used the big mesh pocket a lot, plus the organizer folds up nicely with the stroller. The stroller is a great value for this price
customer_reviews.author: R&J

customer_reviews.title: Great double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Really good option for an inexpensive double stroller! I put together in 20 mins or so... used while we were in Disney... comes with one but we bought an attachment to hold more cups and and snacks since there is no under basket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for our trip to Disney!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller for our Disney trip and it worked out great for our 1 and 3 year old. We bought attachable storage bags since it didn't have an underneath basket. It was the best "smaller" double stroller I could find at a good price with good sun coverage. It was easy to travel with too, folded up quickly with ease. I did step on the middle back wheels a few times while pushing but my husband didn't have that problem, so that might just be me. Some other reviews said that their kids feet on the foot rests pushed down onto the wheels but we didn't seem to have that problem. Overall, very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Neens

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my small Mirage car. But my twins like it. Very heavy. I ordered a stroller bag that clips on the back, because there is no under storage or anywhere to place your baby stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kita Mc

customer_reviews.title: Fine for occasional use when traveling
customer_reviews.text: Fine for occasional use when traveling. Handles are a bit low for everyday use, but this fit our needs of folding compactly, being lightweight, and being sturdy enough for walking around a city during vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Feet kept hitting middle wheels, felt weird to steer, and tough to fit in door ways bc the wide set wheels. I don't recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great double umbrella stroller. We keep this in the car all the time, and it does t take up too much space. The flexible sun shades are well made and fairly large. My kids and I love have the seats can recline—a definite bonus compared to other umbrella strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stroller to use at Disney, but it broke after 3 days. The bottom bar that locks into place with the red plastic release tab came apart. It was easy to use and store. The upright seat back position wasn't straight upright, and the most reclined position was not flat, but adequate for napping.
customer_reviews.author: S. Koller

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for a grandparent to entertain their grandkids.
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids love going for walks with me using this stroller. It is easy for me to push, even up hills with two toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Suzann Morin Steffen

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful stroller! The canopies are amazing and do great job of blocking light. My only drawback is that it only has a lap belt harness and not the 5-point harness, and although I'm sure it would take a lot for your child to fall out I would prefer the shoulder harness as well for piece of mind. We also have never had a problem fitting through any door and the maneuvering of this stroller is great!
customer_reviews.author: Christine J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stroller for the price. Is very light and easy to stroll. It doesn't have space for storage, but you can hang a diaper bag or any bag with straps to the stroller's handles. It's super easy to fold and put on the trunk. I love it and I loved the price. I use it for a 3yrs. old and a one month old baby, I placed an extra baby sit cover to make it more comfortable for the baby, although the stroller does come with a padded sit cover already.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and helpfull stroller
customer_reviews.text: Excelent stroller, I used for my 12 months and 3 yo babies. Enough space, easy to handle, very light, and can fit on my trunk and still have plenty space ( I have a toyoto corolla). I walked to the play ground and I could even fit my daughter bike and my bag. It is small enough to fit on door, so you wont have any problem when you go to the mall.
customer_reviews.author: Elit Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Returned- cheaply made, poor safety feaurea
customer_reviews.text: No over the shoulder straps. My 10 month old climbed right out. Yikes!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime D.

customer_reviews.title: Grandparents must have
customer_reviews.text: With two grandkids so close together in age this is a must have. Excellent quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: If your child is anywhere near the weight limit, do not buy this stroller. It literally fell apart the second time we used it. Very cheap. Spend $25 more and buy something much sturdier. Both the bars bend downward and it’s so annoying to be constantly fixing it so it will function
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Everything great light weight steers well fits through doors just fine ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything great light weight steers well fits through doors just fine as long as the person pushing it is precise in aiming. Only downside are the hoods they are annoying trying to adjust just right! Still have to use a blanket to shade from sun that hits the top of heads when trying to protect their faces from sun. Always fixing. The hoods snap doesn’t stay in one place having to reinforce it often.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an international trip i have planned and i didn't want to have to take my bulky uno to duo stroller. Light weight - yes Easy to assemble - yes (i put it together alone with both toddlers all over me in 30mins or so) Easy to maneuver - yes Durability pretty good
customer_reviews.author: BIANCA

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy the stroller folds up. The kids fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy gaines

customer_reviews.title: we love this, it folds up great
customer_reviews.text: we love this, it folds up great, does not take up no where near as much room, was delivered on time with instructions and assembly was easy and fast. We did notice that the canopies do not fold up too well, when you open up to use they stay in the folded position and will curve back out. But they do extend far enough that the shape does not matter for the use, just looks really weird.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: been using this stroller for 3 years now holds up great and still in good condition
customer_reviews.author: JoBo BinBo(Jonathan Dave Williams)

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend for kids under 2, for they will lean and fall out.
customer_reviews.author: BRI

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain double umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter than my other double stroller. Had a little trouble assembling the canopy but overall a very easy stroller to put together. I do agree with other users are far as tripping over middle wheel in rear if you walk to close. As well as a very flimsy canopy. One side looks lopsided compared to the other. Would have been nice with storage room. Price was right though.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Intravaia

customer_reviews.title: This works great for my 2 yr old and 3
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my 2 yr old and 3.5 yr old. I like that it folds compact and fits in the back of the car. The cup holder doesn't stay on. When I unfold the stroller I always need to double check that the seats are attached to the poles since they often come unsnapped when folded.
customer_reviews.author: Megret

customer_reviews.title: So glad we made this last minute purchase for our vacation ...
customer_reviews.text: So glad we made this last minute purchase for our vacation instead of hauling around our huge double. Awesome travel stroller. Lays back for kids to rest. Just wish there was some kind of storage
customer_reviews.author: CM Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Kolcraft never disappoints!
customer_reviews.text: Kolcraft stollers are so well made. They use high Quality materials. Everything clicks into place. Nothing is ever a cheap on the strollers. I own a single stroller but wanted to get a double for the airport. It’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bahl

customer_reviews.title: The best for the best price
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is awesome. Very easy to use and very light. Plus very comfy for my baby and toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Betty and lester

product_meta.title: Kolcraft Cloud Lightweight and Compact Double Umbrella Stroller, Red/Black
product_meta.description:
Travel light and nimble with the Kolcraft Cloud Double Stroller. This stroller is extra lightweight at only 21 lbs and features a parent cup holder and quick and compact umbrella fold for families on the go. Loaded with features, this double umbrella stroller provides ultimate child comfort with independently reclining seats, roll-up cool climate seat backs and expandable canopy coverage. Folded Dimensions are 13" L x 12.5" W x 43.5"H and assembled dimensions are 31" L x 31" W x 38.5" H. The Maximum child weight per seat is 35 lbs (70 lbs total). As the manufacturer, Kolcraft stands behind all our products with great customer service and support. If there is anything we can do to help you out, please let us know. Best of all, this Kolcraft double stroller is Disney Size Approved!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Kolcraft is a third generation family-owned American Manufacturer of baby products specializing in top-rated crib mattresses, nursery furniture, family-friendly strollers and other dependable products for your baby. As the manufacturer, we stand behind all our products with great customer service and support. If there is anything we can do to help you, please let us know.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT & MANEUVERABLE -- Weighs only 21lbs so you can travel light and nimble with two children. The width of this stroller fully assembled is 31 inches which should allow this stroller to roll through any standard door smoothly. Maximum Child Weight: 35 lbs per seat (70 lbs total).
EASY FOLD -- Quick and compact umbrella fold for portability and easy travel. Folded dimensions: 13 x 12.5 x 43.5 inches (L x W x H)
EXPANDABLE CANOPY -- Expandable, independent canopies with visor extensions and rear hood for extra UV coverage.
INDEPENDENTLY RECLINING SEAT -- Convenient independently reclining seats with padded 3-point safety harness. (Seats recline separately)
ROLL-UP SEAT BACKS – Cool climate seat backs roll-up for maximum air flow in warm weather.
LIGHTWEIGHT & COMPACT -- Assembled Dimensions are 31" (Length) x 31" (Width) x 38.5" (Height) and weights 21 lbs. Does not accommodate car seat.
MANUFACTURER NOTE -- As the manufacturer, Kolcraft stands behind all our products with great customer service and support. If there is anything we can do to help you, please let us know.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars533 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
